description: From Old French (also modern) orle, from orler (“to hem”), or from Vulgar Latin *orula, a diminutive of Latin ora (“edge”), probably from os, oris (“mouth”).

entries.meaning: (heraldry) A bordure that runs around the outline of a shield without touching the edge.
(heraldry) The wreath, or chaplet, surmounting or encircling the helmet of a knight and bearing the crest; a torse.
(architecture) A fillet under the ovolo of a capital.
